content: Island in Singapore **Pulau Seletar** (or **Seletar Island**) is an island in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) waters, in the [Straits of Johor](/wiki/Straits_of_Johor) off the northern coast. It has an area of 38.5 hectares. It is in a bay into which several streams flow, including the waters of mainland Singapore's only [hot spring](/wiki/Hot_spring). Pulau Seletar is in the [planning area](/wiki/Planning_Areas_of_Singapore) of [Simpang](/wiki/Simpang), in which it forms a single subzone of its own. The island is home to [mangrove trees](/wiki/Mangrove), the tallest of which reach a height of 80 feet. This [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) location article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Pulau Seletar
